material.mattext: Now that we have established that it is safe to use the z-test for p for our problem, carry out the test using Excel. Paste the output in window below.

We have a random sample of 316 airplanes, out of which 40 were found to have contaminated water. When we calculate p-hat, we get a value of 0.1266. When we use p-hat to calculate the test statistic z, we get a value of 8.858. Using the NORMSDIST function gives a value of 1, which is the probability that p is less than or equal to the test statistic z. Since we want the probability that p is greater than the test statistic, we subtract this value from 1, giving us a p-value of 0.
